title: Contributing to hello
text: outlines propose change hello. detailed discussion contributing tidyverse packages, please see development contributing guide code review principles.

title: Contributing to hello
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to hello
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed). See guide create great issue advice.

title: Contributing to hello
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("wolfmissotten/hello", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to hello
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use Air apply style, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to hello
text: Please note hello project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

title: hello
text: Load packages:
code: library(hello) library(assertthat) #niet super zeker of dit hier wel moet staan, dit is de enige Imports bij DESCRIPTION package

title: hello
text: can use function hello() add word Hello front string. example, word world: gives output Hello world
code: string <- 'world'  example <- hello(word = string)  print(example) #> [1] "Hello world"

title: hello_detect_language

code: library(hello) library(assertthat) #niet super zeker of dit hier wel moet staan, dit is de enige Imports bij DESCRIPTION package

title: hello_detect_language
text: can use function hello_detect_language() detect language basic greetings English, French, Spanish, German Italian
